author: VNExplorer
title: Russian forces plan to put 16-year-old boys on military record in Luhansk region
text:
Illustrative photo (Photo: Getty Images)
Over three months, the occupiers in the Luhansk People’s Republic (LPP) intend to enlist 16-year-old boys for military registration, reports the head of the Luhansk Regional Military Administration, Artem Lysogor.
The respective commissions will start operating in the occupied territory of the Luhansk region from January 10, 2024.
The occupation administration has granted them broad powers to ensure they can complete their tasks by March 31, coinciding with the end of the presidential elections in Russia.
“They will also identify older men who have avoided conscription since the occupation and will register them by December 31,” writes Lysogor.
Shortage of doctors in the region
According to him, businesses, institutions, and organizations have also been involved in this work to obtain the necessary personal data of men. Educational institutions, in particular, are required to ensure the urgent appearance of young men at the military draft offices.
“However, not every settlement in the so-called LPP has an adequate number of specialized doctors,” the head of the administration reports.
Consequently, men will be sent to neighboring districts for medical examinations, while residents of Severodonetsk, Lysychansk, Rubizhne, Kreminna, Svatove, and Troitske have been ordered to register in other cities.
Russians recruiting foreigners for war against Ukraine
Russia has also been involved in recruiting citizens of Cuba for the war in Ukraine, promising them high salaries, bonuses, and vacations.
Recently, it became known that Russian intermediaries are recruiting and selling Nepalese citizens to serve in the Russian army and participate in combat operations against Ukraine.

author: ABC.es
title: Un proyecto pionero quiere enseñarnos a sobrevivir a una catástrofe natural
text: Cruz Roja y Zurich Seguros han presentado las primeras conclusiones de un proyecto pionero en España: \u0027Resilencia comunitaria ante riesgos climatológicos\u0027. Tiene como objetivo compensar y reforzar las capacidades personales, comunitarias e institucionales para que los ciudadanos puedan adaptarse a las inundaciones u olas de calor , fenómenos cada vez más frecuentes. A su vez, también quieren minimizar las consecuencias.Las primeras conclusiones del informe explican las fortalezas y las carencias de las dos ciudades en que se ha desarrollado, Madrid y Valencia. Entre ellas, destacan que los hogares que carecen de salud financiera no disponen de ahorros para afrontar imprevistos. Asimismo, existe un alto porcentaje de hogares que sufren pobreza energética, lo que perjudica su acceso a servicios energéticos esenciales, como calefacción, refrigeración, iluminación y agua caliente.La presentación ha sido este jueves, 20 de junio, en la sede de la Cruz Roja Española con María del Mar Pageo, presidenta de Cruz Roja Española; Vicente Cancio , CEO Grupo Zurich en España e Iñigo Vila , director de la Unidad de Emergencias de Cruz Roja Española. Según ha explicado Mar Pageo «la urgencia de este proyecto nace por diversos factores. En primer lugar, porque desde 1970 ha aumentado el promedio anual de catástrofes naturales a nivel mundial, según el Informe Mundial de Desastres de la FICR del año 2022». Noticias Relacionadas estandar No Regreso del calor veraniego: más de 30 grados en estas zonas María Albert estandar No ¿Hasta qué día seguirán las tormentas y lluvias torrenciales en España? El día que se aleja la vaguada María CarbajoAdemás, la presidenta afirma que la mayor parte de los desastres registrados son de origen climático. «El riesgo de desastre por origen climatológico constituye una amenaza real para todas las personas y ningún país quedara exento de sus efecto», ha advertido Mar Pageo.Este proyecto se realizará en tres años. En este primer año, se ha redactado información a partir de encuestas a los vecinos de dos barrios de Madrid, San Cristóbal y Vistalegre, y cinco en Valencia, Martaxalenes, Ciudad Jardín, L\u0027Amistat, Ayora y La Punta , analizando su situación actual. Según ha explicado Cancio en la presentación «en este primer año de proyecto, la Fundación Zurich y Zurich Seguros han invertido más de 1.400.000 euros. Esperamos que se inviertan medidas efectivas, es decir, que se pase a la acción».La alerta tempranaEl informe también señala la necesidad de más información sobre diferentes recursos, ya que existe una gran desconocimiento sobre la existencia de medios para gestión de desastres, como los mapas de riesgos, los presupuestos de recuperación para las inundaciones o el Plan de Acción Olas de Calor. Vila también ha señalado que otro factor crucial es «la brecha digital y otros factores limitantes impiden que estos grupos reciban información critica, lo que los coloca en mayor riesgo ante los meteorológicos adversos». Otras cuestiones que destaca el informe es que «existe un gran desconocimiento sobre cómo prepararse ante inundaciones. Cómo es el trato con el agua contaminada, cómo son las evacuaciones seguras o como hay que preparar el hogar». Asimismo, según las encuestas, los usuarios aseguran que carecen de conocimientos teóricos y prácticos sobre qué son los mensajes de alerta temprana ni cómo actuar. La alerta temprana consiste en estar informado y listo para actuar ante situaciones de emergencia. «Los canales de difusión del sistema de alerta temprana pueden incluir, por ejemplo, notificaciones automáticas a teléfonos móviles, alertas por radio o televisión, sirenas, megáfonos, personas que van de puerta en puerta, etc. Los sistema de alerta temprana (SAT) pueden salvar vidas y reducir los impactos de eventos extremos», explica el director en el informe.Además, Vila razona que los elementos centrales del SAT son el pronóstico anticipado de condiciones peligrosas, que las comunidades reciban advertencias basadas en esos pronósticos y que las advertencias sean procesables. «Las comunidades deben de estar preparadas para utilizar esas advertencias». Vila ha asegurado que «para paliar este tipo de situaciones, estamos trabajando en diferentes ámbitos» . El director ha puesto varios ejemplos, como realizar mapeos de recursos climáticos o «realizar capacitaciones y formaciones dirigidas a la población sobre preparaciones, planificación y actuación antes una emergencia». Asimismo, ha explicado que quieren distribuir un kit de primera respuesta, basado en una mochila porta documentos, botella de agua, crema solar, repelente, abanico... Para poder afrontar las situaciones de emergencia.

author: GB Times
title: Why do I get pop UPS on my phone?
text:
Why Do I Get Pop-Ups on My Phone?
Direct Answer:
Pop-ups on your phone can be frustrating and intrusive, interrupting your daily activities and disturbing your focus. But why do you get them in the first place? In this article, we’ll explore the common reasons behind these annoying pop-ups and provide some helpful tips to minimize their occurrence.
Types of Pop-Ups:
Before we dive into the reasons behind pop-ups, let’s identify the types of pop-ups you might encounter on your phone:
• Advertising pop-ups : These are the most common type, which appear as ads or notifications to promote products or services.
• Notification pop-ups : These are alerts or messages from apps, such as Facebook, Twitter, or WhatsApp, which may be important or trivial.
• Malware pop-ups : These are malicious software alerts, often designed to deceive users into installing more malware or revealing sensitive information.
Common Reasons for Pop-Ups:
Now that we’ve covered the types of pop-ups, let’s dive into the common reasons behind them:
Table of Contents
Toggle
1. Malware Infections 2. Outdated or Infected Apps 3. Push Notifications 4. Browser Extensions and Add-ons 5. Device Settings and Configuration 1. Malware Infections
Malware is software designed to harm your device or steal sensitive information. It can be installed through:
Downloading infected apps or files
Visiting compromised websites
Using public Wi-Fi or unsecured networks
Malware can cause:
• Displaying unwanted ads or pop-ups
• Redirecting your browser to unknown sites
• Stealing login credentials or personal data
2. Outdated or Infected Apps
Outdated apps can lead to compatibility issues and pop-ups, while infected apps can spread malware and viruses. Make sure to:
• Regularly update your apps
• Only download apps from trusted sources
• Read user reviews and check ratings before installing
3. Push Notifications
Push notifications are messages sent from apps to your phone. While some apps use them to deliver important updates, others may abuse this feature by:
• Sending excessive notifications
• Displaying irrelevant or annoying ads
To minimize push notifications:
• Review app permissions and disable notifications for unnecessary apps
• Turn off notifications for specific apps
• Use a notification blocker or app like Freedom or Moment
4. Browser Extensions and Add-ons
Browser extensions can track your browsing history, display ads, and pop-up unwanted notifications. Be cautious when installing extensions, and:
• Choose extensions from trusted sources
• Regularly review and update your extensions
• Remove unnecessary or suspicious extensions
5. Device Settings and Configuration
Device settings can also contribute to pop-ups. Make sure to:
• Regularly update your operating system and browser
• Disable unknown or suspicious sources
• Review and adjust your app permissions
Use a pop-up blocker like Pop-up Blocker for Chrome or Firefox
Common Causes of Pop-Ups in Specific Apps:
Some apps may exhibit specific behavior that leads to pop-ups. Check if your app is:
App
Common Cause
Solution
Facebook
Too many notifications or excessive usage
Limit notifications, log out of the app, or use a notification blocker
Email Clients
Spam or phishing emails
Update your email client, use two-factor authentication, and mark spam emails
Banking Apps
Malware or fraudulent activities
Regularly update your app, enable two-factor authentication, and monitor your accounts closely
Conclusion:
Pop-ups can be frustrating, but understanding the reasons behind them can help you take steps to minimize their occurrence. By being cautious with downloads, updates, and app permissions, and using pop-up blockers or notification managers, you can reduce the frequency of unwanted pop-ups on your phone. Stay safe and enjoy a smoother, ad-free experience!

author: @KCRG
title: Cedar Rapids Police: 67 vehicle accidents due to weather
text: Cedar Rapids Police: 67 vehicle accidents due to weather CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa (KCRG) - With wintry weather hitting Cedar Rapids, police have released vehicle accident reports related to this morning’s weather. Officials say 67 vehicle accidents and 33 vehicle hazards (stuck, disabled, or immobilized) occurred this morning directly relating to the weather. Cedar Rapids Fire was called out to two of those accidents to assist with injuries. Neither was reportedly serious. The City of Cedar Rapids officially ended their ‘snow event’ at 4:00 pm, meaning property owners now have 24 hours to clear snow and ice from their sidewalks. In order to keep people safe, officials have released the following tips for safe driving in wintry conditions: - Do not follow plows too closely. During their operation, they occasionally have to stop and back up. - Reduce your speeds. - Use caution in turns. - Avoid sudden moves. - Accelerate and brake carefully and slowly. - Leave more room between vehicles. - Increase your braking distance. More information can be found at the link [here.](https://cedar-rapids.org/local_government/departments_g_-_v/public_works/snow_and_ice_control.php) Copyright 2024 KCRG. All rights reserved.

author: Jeroslyn JoVonn
title: Mia X Inducted Into Rice University’s Hip Hop Archival Collection
text:
Rice University’s Center for Engaged Research and Collaborative Learning (CERCL) just added the First Lady of No Limit Records to its growing Hip-Hop Archival Collection to celebrate her trailblazing contributions to rap music.
Mia X was honored on Sept. 18 as a hip-hop pioneer through Rice University’s “Mia X: Soldier, Survivor, Savant” event held inside the Grand Hall at the Rice Memorial Center. The prestigious school hailed as a “New Ivy” by Forbes , added Mia X to the collection to celebrate her role as the first female rapper signed to Master P’s No Limit Records and her diverse three-decade career as an artist, entrepreneur, and educator.
Her induction into the Hip Hop Archival Collection honors Mia X’s influence as an artist whose work explores social justice, race, and empowerment themes. Mia X is celebrated for serving as a trailblazer with her feminist-focused lyrics of the 1990s and activism, in which she most recently used her lyrical flow to motivate people to get the COVID-19 vaccine on “Vax That Thang Up” with Juvenile and Mannie Fresh.
“Mia X is a major figure in the history of hip-hop, blazing a path many others have followed,” said Anthony Pinn, the Agnes Cullen Arnold Distinguished Professor of Humanities and founding director of CERCL and Rice’s Center for African and African American Studies.
“Having Mia X contribute to the CERCL Hip Hop Archival Collection helps us to extend Rice’s engagement with the expansive geography of hip-hop. We are excited to bring Mia X to campus, and we look forward to our ongoing connection.”
A panel discussion was held to honor Mia X’s contributions that featured Pinn, Chinara Butler (widow of the late Pimp C), and G Dash, a key figure in the SwishaHouse movement. The discussion delved into topics that covered Mia X’s pioneering influence and the lasting impact of her work on culture.
The Hip Hop Archival Collection, founded by Pinn to preserve hip-hop’s cultural significance, is central to CERCL’s mission of documenting and honoring hip-hop’s cultural significance, especially in the South, where artists like Mia X have played a key role in shaping the genre’s evolution. The collection, housed in Fondren Library’s Woodson Research Center, also emphasizes its role as a platform for intellectual and community leadership.
Mia X’s inception follows that of rap pioneers Pimp C, Too Short, K-Rino, and SwishaHouse.
RELATED CONTENT: Hip Hop Hall Of Fame Celebrates The Culture With UPCOMING CAFE AND MUSEUM IN HARLEM

author: PrimaMedia.ru
title: Смартфон за 1 рубль и оплаченная связь: Билайн запустил новую акцию - PrimaMedia.ru
text:
В Билайне стартовала новая акция — смартфоны Redmi от Xiaomi можно забрать всего за 1 рубль при покупке бонусных рублей на связь, сообщает пресс-служба Билайна.
Всё просто: достаточно перейти на страницу акции "Смартфон за 1 рубль", выбрать понравившееся устройство из акционного списка и добавить его в корзину в составе выгодного комплекта.
Среди участников акции — смартфоны Redmi А3х, А3 и А3 Pro. В зависимости от модели вам будут доступны бонусные рубли, которые вы сможете потратить на услуги связи — именно они составят почти всю сумму вашего заказа. В итоге клиент получает смартфон за 1 рубль, новую сим-карту (в комплект не входит) и оплаченную связь на много месяцев вперед (в зависимости от того, как вы будете расходовать свой тарифный план). Предложение доступно для новых и действующих клиентов Билайна.
Смартфоны Redmi А3х, А3 и А3 Pro — это современные и надёжные устройства, сочетающие в себе функциональность, стильный дизайн и доступную цену. Модели оснащены всем необходимым для комфортного повседневного использования: улучшенными камерами для ярких снимков, емкими аккумуляторами, быстрыми процессорами и актуальными функциями для современных пользователей. Благодаря удобному интерфейсу и проверенному качеству Xiaomi смартфоны подходят как для работы, так и для учёбы, путешествий и отдыха.
Количество товара ограничено. Акция проводится с 8 июля по 11 августа 2025 года в интернет-магазине и собственных офисах обслуживания Билайна. Подробности, условия и ограничения — на сайте beeline.ru.
Реклама. Рекламодатель: ПАО "ВымпелКом".
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->products and services

author: Purna Singh
title: New Delhi: Party's objective is public welfare, says Mallikarjun Kharge
text: New Delhi : The Congress has always worked towards building an India that is based on parliamentary democracy and equality, its president Mallikarjun Kharge said on Thursday as the party celebrates its 139th foundation day and kickstarts its Lok Sabha poll campaign with a mega rally in Nagpur. In a post on X, Kharge said, "The objective of the Indian National Congress is public welfare and progress of the people of India."The Congress believes in an India that is based on parliamentary democracy, where there is equality and opportunities for all without any discrimination, and where political, economic and social rights enshrined in the Constitution are followed, he said. "We are proud that for the last 138 years we have been struggling with full honesty to build such an India. My heartiest greetings to every Indian on the occasion of Congress' foundation day," he said. "The Congress represents the will of the people. It is synonymous with struggle, compassion, freedom, justice and equality. On the solemn occasion of Congress foundation day, we reaffirm our unwavering commitment to protect the Constitution of India and uphold the values of democracy," he said in another post on X. To mark the occasion, Kharge hoisted the national flag at the party headquarters here in the presence of senior leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Wishing party workers on X, former Congress president Rahul Gandhi said he is proud to be part of an organisation like the Congress, which has truth and non-violence as its foundation, love, fraternity, respect and equality as its pillars, and patriotism as its roof. Party general secretary K C Venugopal, in a post on X, said the Congress is a party that fought for "our cherished freedom".

author: MENAFN
title: Weather Today: IMD Issues Red Alert In Maharashtra, MP Orange Alert In Kerala, Himachal, Uttarakhand And More
text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert for extremely heavy rains in Madhya Maharashtra, East Madhya Pradesh today i.e. 2 August. As per IMD, a very heavy rain alert has been issued in several parts of the country including Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Uttarakhand, Konkan, Goa, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Karnataka, Assam, Meghalaya. 1. In Maharashtra, a yellow alert has been issued in Mumbai, Thane, and Palghar while an orange alert for very heavy rains is issued in Raigad, Ratnagiri, and Sindhudurg. In addition to this, a Red alert for extremely heavy rains is predicted in the ghat areas of Pune, Kolhapur, and Satara. 2. In Himachal Pradesh , cloudbursts hit the districts of Mandi, Shimla, and Kullu. As a result, approximately 50 people are reported missing, and two bodies have been found. The Additional Chief Secretary of Himachal Pradesh Onkar Chand Sharma said that an alert of heavy rain has been issued till August 2. The orange alert has been issued in the Kanga district on Friday while heavy rains are also predicted in Sirmaur, Solan, Mandi and Shimla. 3. The IMD Kerala issued an orange alert in the Wayanad district until Saturday, which has already been affected by landslides claiming over 200 lives. IMD Kerala director, Neetha K Gopal, said“We have issued an orange alert in 4 northern districts of Kerala, including Wayanad. In the south, up to Pathanamthitta, we have also issued a yellow alert. From tomorrow on, there will be a be a considerable reduction in rainfall activity. So the yellow alerts are being confirmed only for the northern districts of Kerala. And then from Sunday there will be a reduction and we will be experiencing only light to moderate rain thereafter for another four days.” 4. Light rain showers were experienced in parts of Delhi early this morning and the IMD has forecasted intermittent rain in the national capital until August 5. 5. Speaking of other states, as per IMD , heavy to very heavy rainfall has been predicted over Konkan, Goa, Madhya Maharashtra, Gujarat Region during 1st-5th August; Madhya Pradesh during 1st–4th August; Vidarbha, Chhattisgarh during 1st-3rd August and Saurashtra, Kutch on 03rd August. In addition to this, heavy rainfall is very likely at isolated places over Marathwada on the 3rd August and Saurashtra, Kutch on the 4th August. 6. Uttarakhand is likely to experience this weather from August 1st to 3rd, and East Rajasthan from August 1st to 4th while isolated heavy rainfall is forecasted over Jammu and Kashmir and Rajasthan from August 1st to 5th, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand from August 1st to 7th, Uttar Pradesh from August 1st to 3rd and on the 6th and 7th, and Punjab and Haryana-Chandigarh on August 1st and 2nd. 7. The weather department predicted very heavy rainfall at isolated places over South Interior Karnataka, Coastal Karnataka on 2nd August. As per IMD, heavy rainfall very likely at isolated places over Coastal & South Interior Karnataka during 1st-4th August; Kerala and Mahe on 2nd and 3rd August. 8. In North East India, very heavy rains has been predicted over Assam & Meghalaya on 2nd August; Sub-Himalayan West Bengal & Sikkim on 5th August. 9. The weather office also issued heavy rain alert over Jharkhand, Odisha, Gangetic West Bengal on 2nd August while in Bihar, Assam, Meghalaya, Sub-Himalayan West Bengal & Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram & Tripura during 1st-7th August.
